1�Gathering data.
1�When traded to the Hazhalm Testing Grounds' Entry Gate,  $???? will light and become  $????.
1�From that moment, the owner of the #???? will reserve and gain access to one of the facility's many chambers.
1�By using the #???? it will produce a replica of itself which can be given to another, granting him or her access to the same chamber.
1�Though an infinite number of lamps can be produced using this method, only a maximum of thirty-six people can venture into the same chamber.
1�Once thirty-six souls have crossed the seal, all lamps outside the grounds will cease to function.
1�These lamps will also cease to function the instant any adventurer within the chamber engages in battle, regardless of how many people have already passed through the gates.
1�To teleport to the reserved chamber, one must simply trade their #???? to the Entry Gate.
1�However, please note that not everyone in possession of a lamp will be allowed into Hazhalm.
1�As mentioned before, only up to thirty-six people may enter a chamber. Even those with a valid #???? will not be allowed entry if the chamber has reached its maximum capacity.
1�Also, as a safety precaution, players below level sixty and those with the Battlefield status in effect will be denied entry.

1�After visiting the testing grounds, one must wait 
 ?[hour/hours] (Earth time) before he is granted access again.
1�This not only pertains to the chamber previously visited, but all areas within the testing grounds.
1�The amount of waiting time remaining before re-entry is permitted can be viewed by checking Hazhalm's Entry Gate.
1�All monsters dwelling in the testing grounds can be attacked by anyone, regardless of party or alliance.
1�In addition, any items dropped by a foe can be lotted on by anyone in the chamber.
1�However, please be aware that any items that have not been lotted on when a chamber's reservation is up will be distributed at random.

1�Also, if everyone in a chamber remains KO'd for longer than 
 ?[minute/minutes], they will all be automatically teleported from the grounds.1���
1�Oh my Gob! You're one of those adventurerurers, aren't ya?You got nothin' on me, ?[man./lady.] I was just mindin' my own businesesess, lookin' for junk an' stuff.
1�Hey, watch out. You don't wanna fight me. I'll turn you into meat jerky!Wait, how about you and me be friends instead? Sound good?
1�I travel all over the world and hear lots of differererent stories. I even hear your stories. I can tell you one, if you want.
1�Do you want to hear a story?No, thank you.Let's hear one.

1�What story would you like to be told?On second thought, maybe later.Path of Blood(pt.1).Path of Blood(pt.2).The Rider Cometh(pt.1).The Rider Cometh(pt.2).Unwavering Resolve(pt.1).Unwavering Resolve(pt.2).Unwavering Resolve(pt.3).A Stygian Pact(pt.1).A Stygian Pact(pt.2).
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Oh...Well, if that's the case, I'm outta here.
1�Now, listen close...
1�Wh-what...what's happening?
1�Where do we go from here?
1�Oho.Why, it's not even hot...
1�Oho!  to the rescue again!
1�How curious...The fire burns fiercely, and yet makes no sound...
1�Ah...didn't the Imperial Army seal off the entrance to the underworld?
1�Ngh...this wind!
1�Luzaf...
1�What...what's happening!?
s!�Luzaf...!
1�Luzaf!
1�Your injuries!?
1�Thank you,  .
1�Yes.That wind blew with such a familiar melody...
1�It reminded me of the gentle breeze that always stirs the air around the Gordeus...
1�I think I'll be just fine.
1�Hurry to do what?
1�Destroy it!?But, the iron giant is--
1�The Age of Judgment.With the victor deciding the laws of justice...
1�Razfahd!
1�Wait! We command you to release this man!
1�Does our authority mean nothing!?
1�You cannot!
1�Do you betray the Empress? Betray your own sister!?
1�Who ?[he/she] truly works for...?
1�What are you talking about?  works for me!
1�No, you are the one who is deceiving himself...
1�You understand nothing about Luzaf's spirit...or  's heart!
1�(Listen to me,  ...)
1�(You must take this to Salaheem's Sentinels.)
?!�We all have our masks!
1�I hid my true identity from  ...
1�But even so, ?[he/she] still comes to my rescue.
1�This blaze is not of Urhguum.
1�If there were no illumination of this world present, this conflagration would completely escape your mortal gaze...
1�It is a flame of the underworld.
1�Stay back!
1�The flame produces no heat, but it will scorch your soul, and consume your flesh...
1�Assuming a construct such as you had a soul...or flesh.
1�Great Odin!
1�Sovereign of darkness and battle, lord of the underworld!
1�Your humble servant Luzaf stands on the threshold of your domain.
1�Silence.
1�The manifestation begins...
u!�Are you harmed!?
1�Flit!6You knew this would happen!
1�Yes, my lord.
1�Great Odin, Devourer of Light!
1�I wish to know the time that remains to me.
1�Rage? What rage is this?
1�No, not sated...
1�My rage...My rage has subsided.
1�Great Odin.
1�I have uncovered a purpose more deserving than simple revenge.
1�The descendants of Ephramad.
1�I wish to devote the remainder of my existence to building a kingdom in which they can live without fear of persecution.
1�That is now my driving desire.
1�And so I ask for time...time to act freely.
1�I...I do not understand.
1�The next incarnation...?The terms of the pact--
1�And how am I to fulfill this pact?
.!�Flit. There is something I would know.
1�This mercenary of Aphmau's, this... .You are certain ?[he/she] oversees the security of the treasure?
1�Besides the one I entrusted to  , the only other 3???? that exists in this world is the one that you hold. There are no others?
1�Then show me the one you have now.
1�So ?[he/she] is...
1�Right where ?[he/she] is supposed to be...
1�Traitorous imp!
1�The code of the corsair is not to be taken lightly...
1�Great Odin, hear my words!
1�Are you even hearing my words!?
1�It appears not...
.�I must bring an end to this.6Aphmau is in your charge.
1�She is my...no, she is Ephramad's light in the darkness.
1�If this is the incarnation...
1�I am...I am fine...
1�They do not pain me...6I feel no pain at all...
1�Impeccable timing,  .Your arrival allowed me to see through Flit's deception.
1�Aphmau, are you able to walk?
1�If what Flit said was true, we have a short period of grace.
1�But I suggest we hurry while my will is still my own.
1�To destroy the iron colossus...before your brother reactivates it.
1�The savior of the Empire?It may be as you say.
1�But should the fully manifested incarnation of Odin clash with the iron might of Alexander...
1�Yes.If such laws would have meaning in the desolate wasteland sure to be left in the aftermath of the conflict.
1�We must prevent this battle at all costs.
1�After the colossus is rendered harmless, you must then turn your attention to me...
1�We don't have time for this...
1�Aphmau...Empress Nashmeira.Is this the treatment I can expect from your nation?
1�Has nothing changed over the last two hundred years!
d?�So this is your doing,  .But why...?
1�I thank you,  .Because of you, I have discovered the one treasure I thought would elude me forever...peace.
1�Battle after battle you have fought, all to protect her...?You are a ?[man/woman] of uncommon honor indeed.
1�...Forgive me.
1�It is not my place to question a ?[man/woman] who can bend the very gods to ?[his/her] will.
1�If there is anyone who can ride with the Dark Divinity and emerge unscathed, surely it is you.
.?�Bwahahaha. Now you're speaking a language this corsair can understand!
1�Full of pure, unchecked fury like the raging waves of the northern seas.Had you been born a century prior, I would have been proud to count you among my crew.
1�The rules of time and space don't apply equally to this world and that, Miss.
1�By rights, this rent in the curtain between the two worlds, this...dimensional hiccup...shouldn't even exist.
1�No being, from either reality, has the art to mend such a fluke of fortune.
1�Throwing a bunch of laboratory nasties in the path of potential meddlers was about the best they could do.
1�Ain't that right, Boss?
1�Boss!
1�Forget the girl.Do you want Lord Odin to arrive without the warm welcome of his servant?
1�Great Odin, Lord of the Underworld!
1�I trust Your Malevolence is well?
1�Look lively, Boss!
1�We don't want to offend His Maliciousness, now, do we?
1�C'mon, Boss!Stick with the program!
1�Your rage towards the Empire!
1�Well ain't that a sweet idea.
1�Hee hee, hee hee.
1�Didn't I tell you, Boss?
1�You've already made your pact.The contract is signed and sealed.
1�You will become the next incarnation of the Dark Rider--whether you're ready or not.
1�Are non-negotiable.
1�But I'll let you in on a secret, Boss.Before you are completely consumed by the essence of the rider...
1�...there is a period when you will retain free will.
1�Well, that's simple.
1�All you gotta do is remember.
1�Remember how your people suffered and perished at the merciless hands of the Empire.
1�I'm sure the memories are still crystal clear for you.
1�You just gotta hurl that big, venomous ball of rage...
1�Now's your chance!Look! She's defenseless!
1�In any case, she's taken the full force of the Astral Wind...
1�It'd be kinder to just put an end to her--the sooner the better.
1�That's right, Boss!Quick and painless!
1�What? Why does that matter at a time like this?
1�Yes, I'm certain.C'mon, Boss, I showed you the blip on the tracker, didn't I?
1�No, Boss, just the two.Why would I lie to you?
1�I...you see...There's more important...
1�I mean, just look at the tracker. Right smack in the middle of Talacca Cove. The mercenary is right where ?[he's/she's] supposed to be.
1�Hee hee...hee...
1�D-Dark...<cough>...Rider...Flit...<splutter>...at your...service...
..�Hee hee, hee hee, hee hee...
e.�Art thou the one who summoned me?
1�Speak thy mind.
1�Hast thou sated thy rage?
1�Hast thou sated thy rage?
1�Hast thou sated thy rage?
u.�In ages past, I oft journeyed the boundless aethyr to pay visit this emerald isle.
1�Who standeth before me? What doth bestir the soul of my knight from our nether abode?
1�Why, 'tis a fellow prisoner to the gaoler of fate.Rejoice, for tonight thy light hath guided me hither.
1�Reveal unto me the wishes of thy base mortal heart.Dost thou seek boundless riches? Eternal glory? Or wouldst thou walk a darker path?
1�Serve bliss unto me with thy blade.If thy strength is true, thy plea shall be heard.
1�Excellent!Thou hast done well to entertain me for the nonce.
1�Thou hast proven thyself worthy of my boon.Speak unto me thy wish.
1�Thou wouldst see my knight unfettered?
1�My knight is one with me, to wander the nether plains for all eternity.Thou shalt receive a reward to meet the measure of thy deeds...
1�...That is thy true desire?
1�Very well.Rejoice, for I grant unto thee thy desire.
1�...That is thy true desire?
1�Very well.Rejoice, for I grant unto thee thy desire.
1�...That is thy true desire?
1�Very well.Rejoice, for I grant unto thee thy desire.
1�Very well.Rejoice, for I grant unto thee thy desire.
1�Very well. 'Tis but a gleed in the vast sea of hellfire that is my power, but I grant unto thee my boon.
1�Is thy heart sated?
1�Nay, never shall it be, for boundless is the avarice of the sons of man.
1�To the victor go the spoils.If thou wouldst claim what thou desirest, stand now and face my blade!
1�Excellent!Thou hast done well to entertain me for the nonce.
1�Thou hast proven thyself worthy of my boon.Speak unto me thy wish.
1�...That is thy true desire?
1�Very well.Rejoice, for I grant unto thee thy desire.
1�...That is thy true desire?
1�Very well.Rejoice, for I grant unto thee thy desire.
1�...That is thy true desire?
1�Very well.Rejoice, for I grant unto thee thy desire.
1�Very well.Rejoice, for I grant unto thee thy desire.
1�Very well. 'Tis but a gleed in the vast sea of hellfire that is my power, but I grant unto thee my boon.
1�I grant thee such a boon as befits thy worth.Claim it, and begone from here.
1�Thy covetous heart remains unsated?
1�Lay bare before me thy unfettered desire, that thou might claim what thou truly seekest.
1�The fool who repeateth his words is but twice the fool.
1�Thou dost think to curry my favor, but I grow only wroth with thine obstinance.
1�Take thy reward and begone from this place.
1�Thy covetous heart remains unsated?
1�Lay bare before me thy unfettered desire, that thou might claim what thou truly seekest.
1�Still thou wouldst persist in this futile endeavor?
1�Thou art either bold or foolish, or mayhap the twain.Not unlike another I know...
1�Take thy reward and begone from this place.
1�Thy covetous heart remains unsated?
1�Lay bare before me thy unfettered desire, that thou might claim what thou truly seekest.
1�Yet, knowing this, thy desire burns still?
1�Thou dost amuse me, mortal.
1�Take thy reward and begone from this place.
1�Thy covetous heart remains unsated?
1�Lay bare before me thy unfettered desire, that thou might claim what thou truly seekest.
1�Thy blade is tempered true.Can the same be said of thy desire?
1�Then let it consume thee whole, 'til not flesh and sinew but sheer, unbated rage guides thy blade.Then, and not before, shall thy plea find audience.
1�And yet, for the momentary amusement thou hast afforded me, I would grant thee guerdon.
1�Grief, rage, rancor...!Feel them surge and eddy within, threat'ning to devour thee!
1�Resist not the tempest, but give thyself over to its gales, that thy blade might sing havoc 'til Ragnarok is come!
1�Ahahahahahaha!!!With each frenzied thrust, thou givest thyself over further to thy rage!
1�Thou dost amuse me, and naught more.Accept my boon and begone.
1�Thy covetous heart remains unsated?
1�Extirp the last shreds of forbearance from thy heart, and stand to meet me anew.
1�His kingdom lost, his name forgotten...that one's release will afford thee naught.
1�...Thine is but rage for rage's sake?
1�Ahahahahahaha!!! Thou showest promise yet!
1�Take thy reward and begone from this place.
1�Thy covetous heart remains unsated?
1�Lay bare before me thy unfettered desire, that thou might claim what thou truly seekest.
1�Bestraught of wit and senses, the piteous mortal knoweth not why ?[he/she] doth battle...
1�...I would hear ?[his/her] name.
1� ...Mayhap I have erred in my judgement of thee.
1�Thy covetous heart remains unsated?
1�Extirp the last shreds of forbearance from thy heart, and stand to meet me anew.
1�I know not from what fount thy frenzy upspringeth...But thou dost fight with an ardour that exceedeth mortal bounds.
1�Not since he who I did claim as my own have I seen the like of thee.
1�Take thy reward and begone from this place.
1�For what end, for whose gain dost thou brandish thy blade?
1�Dost thou claim this thy true desire?Then forswear all ties to that which maketh thee mortal, and come unto me once more.
1�Be thou worthy of the favour thou desirest of me?
1�Be thou worthy of that which I would make of thee?
1�...The hour of judgement is nigh.
1�Take thy reward and begone from this place.
1�Delay not in thy return. Mine ears thirst for thy blade's uplifted sword-song.
1�What wouldst thou make of such knowledge?Wouldst thou reshape the future in thine own twisted image, that not a child be born, not a nation rise save by thy sanction?
1�I grant such a reward as becometh thee.Accept it graciously, and begone from this place.
1�Lay bare before me thy unfettered desire, that thou might claim what thou truly seekest.
1�Through the ages, much have I seen.Fool ?[men/women], their eyes cast open to what has yet to pass, struck mad by the horrors they did gaze upon.
1�Canst thou succeed where thy craven forbears did fail?
1�I grant such a reward as becometh thee.Accept it graciously, and begone from this place.
1�Reflect upon the true nature of thy desire, then seek me anew.
1�Seek wings to take flight, and pay me visit in my nether abode.Shouldst thou prove unworthy of my boon, thy bones shall litter the halls of Asgarth!
1�I grant such a reward as becometh thee.Accept it graciously, and begone from this place.
1�...and the power to achieve thy aims shall be thine.
1�What wouldst thou make of such power?Soil the fields with the blood of thine enemies, that the rivers run crimson for summers after?
1�I grant such a reward as becometh thee.Accept it graciously, and begone from this place.
1�Lay bare before me thy unfettered desire, that thou might claim what thou truly seekest.
1�Through the ages, much have I seen.Witless monarchs, gifted authority absolute, who succeeded only in plumbing the depths of corruption and depravity.
1�Canst thou succeed where thy forbears, o'ercrowed by vice, did fail?
1�I grant such a reward as becometh thee.Accept it graciously, and begone from this place.
1�Reflect upon the true nature of thy desire, then seek me anew.
1�Seek wings to take flight, and pay me visit in my nether abode.Shouldst thou prove unworthy, thy bones shall litter the halls of Asgarth!
1�I grant such a reward as becometh thee.Accept it graciously, and begone from this place.
1�...and the power to achieve thy aims shall be thine.
1�What wouldst thou make of this ingenuity?Wouldst thou enslave bird and beast, bend the very laws of nature to serve thy base desires?
1�I grant such a reward as becometh thee.Accept it graciously, and begone from this place.
1�Lay bare before me thy unfettered desire, that thou might claim what thou truly seekest.
1�Through the ages, much have I seen.Foolhardy ?[men/women], clever beyond their means, fostering only ruin where they would spur advancement.
1�Canst thou succeed where thy forbears in their ignorance failed?
1�I grant such a reward as becometh thee.Accept it graciously, and begone from this place.
1�Reflect upon the true nature of thy desire, then seek me anew.
1�Seek wings to take flight, and pay me visit in my nether abode.Shouldst thou prove unworthy, thy bones shall litter the halls of Asgarth!
1�I grant such a reward as becometh thee.Accept it graciously, and begone from this place.
1�...and the power to achieve thy aims shall be thine.
1�What wouldst thou make of such passion?Seize the hearts of those around thee, that they would gladly die a thousand deaths to be but graced with thy smile?
1�I grant such a reward as becometh thee.Accept it graciously, and begone from this place.
1�Lay bare before me thy unfettered desire, that thou might claim what thou truly seekest.
1�Through the ages, much have I seen.Fool ?[men/women] who strove to be loved by all, only to die alone, despis'd by even their once-truest companions.
1�Canst thou succeed where thy forbears in their covetousness failed?
1�I grant such a reward as becometh thee.Accept it graciously, and begone from this place.
1�Reflect upon the true nature of thy desire, then seek me anew.
1�Seek wings to take flight, and pay me visit in my nether abode.Shouldst thou prove unworthy, thy bones shall litter the halls of Asgarth!
1�I grant such a reward as becometh thee.Accept it graciously, and begone from this place.
1�...and the power to achieve thy aims shall be thine.

1�What wouldst thou make of such glory?Wouldst thou have minstrels sing thy praises even as their throats parch with thirst, and thy subjects laud thy mercy even as they huddle starving in the streets?
1�I grant such a reward as becometh thee.Accept it graciously, and begone from this place.
1�Lay bare before me thy unfettered desire, that thou might claim what thou truly seekest.
1�Through the ages, much have I seen.?[Kings/Queens] of ruined nations, demanding the undying devotion of their subjects who lay starving in the streets.
1�Wilt thou not but repeat the mistakes of thy thrice-prideful forbears?
1�I grant such a reward as becometh thee.Accept it graciously, and begone from this place.
1�Reflect upon the true nature of thy desire, then seek me anew.
1�Seek wings to take flight, and pay me visit in my nether abode.Shouldst thou prove unworthy, thy bones shall litter the halls of Asgarth!
1�I grant such a reward as becometh thee.Accept it graciously, and begone from this place.
1�...and the power to achieve thy aims shall be thine.
1�Thy appeal is heard.
1�In all things, there is order.One star from the heavens falls, and another is birthed in its stead.
1�Such is my bargain.In return for that one's soul, I would claim thine.
l.�Rise, my knight!Thou shalt serve me well, lest the bonds of thy successor be wrought from thine entrails.
1�Thy coveted prize sits on a pedestal before thee.Claim it or turn away, it matters not to me.
1�Thou hast proven thyself worthy of my boon.Speak unto me thy wish.
